title: @Riot Meddler Any plans on Dorans Ring Changes to prevent stacking
body:
Feels pretty awful when tanks have kill pressure while also having a CC lock, Take Galio for instance his waveclear is insane but comes with the tradeoff of spamming it costing a ton of mana early but 2-3 dorans rings negates this tradeoff and even lets Galio burst enemies in the laning phase.

The item just feels too cost efficient for it's stats comparatively to other starters and as such lets someone who was behind have better stats than someone who invested in item components, now i'm not saying this should be outright removed but i feel like Dorans items shouldn't sell as well as they do someone who opted for this early game pressure can just as easily sell off one to two of them and only be down 480 gold.

Another option is to cut down the mana Regen or AP since champions who are buying these are able to clear waves and still easily contest someone ahead of them with the all in power of stacking dorans.

I don't really have a problem with mages stacking this item as assassins in the mid lane are countered by this stratgy but now that they have banchee's veil as a great anti ap assassin item they don't need to rely on dorans stacking as much.  I mind tanks abusing this though, there is no way a tank who messed up and died early should be able to bully as hard as they can with 2-3 dorans.

replies.body: We're looking at making the mana on kill unique. Stacking DRings is something we want to be an option in some cases at least, suspect we need a bit more trade off than there currently is though.

How about allowing them to stack only up to 2 of them?
It's a pretty standard build for midlaners who don't want to rush a mana item but still want some early mana sustain, and I don't think they need that taken away because some top lane tanks are abusing triple d ring

That punishes mages when it was tanks abusing them, that's not fair for mage players!

If you go through with this then having to pick up an early armguard pretty well screws your lane since you won't be able to keep up with mana sustain against ad mids!

Tanks will just go back to ordinary starts and builds, but now mages get a perfectly fair and non-abusive early build wrecked just because somebody else was misusing it!

Maybe I'm missing something crucial but, _why is stacking D.Rings such a big issue/problem_?

It helps weak laning champs / players that are behind, invest in some early mana/hp regen/ap/hp, but it will still set them back in terms of mid to late game builds if they stack 3 or more. They're not exactly cheap (and not exactly expensive, either).

This reminds me of Singed players basically having to stack dark seals early in order to survive most matchups.

Is there some extreme isolated abuse case with D.Rings that I'm not fully aware of?
Galio and Gragas have a ton of mana sustain with the triple Dorans rings. Enough to just spam their aoe Qs and clear waves removing what is supposed to be a weakness for them.
then you nerf galio and gragas wave clear against minions you dont crap on every weak laning phase mage in the game for the sake of dismal balancing. this is a bad change.

I do agree that Galio and Gragas both need nerfs relative to other tanks.

But I also think regardless of what top lane ap tank is on top top lane atm DRings overshadow any other options there could be.

This is probably just the right change though if multiple DRings is still usable. Probably not ideal compared to upgrading potion or grabbing dark seals and health items.

I'm also of the thought regular tank item build pieces and some support items should be more competitive for laning
